annotinus: <entryFree id="n2685" type="main" key="anno_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annōtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from annus, as diutinus from diu</etym>, <sense id="n2685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a year old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of last year</hi> (only in prose and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum annotinis (navibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (the paraphrast: <foreign lang="greek">sun tai=s tou= pro/sqen e)/tous</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus fructus cum annotino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 44, § 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
annoto: <entryFree id="n2686" type="main" key="anno^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nŏto</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put a note to</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to write down</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to note down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comment on</hi> (only in post-Aug. prose, like its derivatives annotatio, annotator, annotamentum, etc.). </sense><sense id="n2686.1" n="I. A." level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meminisset atque adnotaret, quid et quando et cui dedisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scriptis adnotare quaedam ut tumida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber legebatur, adnotabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā in re et aliud adnotare succurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod annales adnotavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 6, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus in orthographiā pauca adnotabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:14:7 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 14, 7 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n2686.2" n="B" level="2"> = animadvertere, <hi rend="ital">to observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adnotāsset insculptum monumento militem Gallum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2686.3" n="C" level="2"> Adnotare librum, <hi rend="ital">to give a book some title</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entitle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denominate</hi>: ausus est libros suos <foreign lang="greek">filalhqei=s</foreign> adnotare, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n2686.4" n="D" level="2"> Annotari, <hi rend="ital">to be distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted for something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec litora pisce nobili adnotantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2686.5" n="II" level="1"> Judic. t. t. </sense><sense id="n2686.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">register an absent person among the accused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absens requirendus, adnotandus est, ut copiam sui praestet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:17:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2686.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To note or designate one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">already condemned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for punishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos, quia cives Romani erant, adnotavi in urbem remittendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl>; 7, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 56</bibl> Schwarz; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
annualis: <entryFree id="n2687" type="main" key="annu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>annus</etym>, <sense id="n2687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a year old</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">agni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: cum operario annuali, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 37, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
annubilo: <entryFree id="n2688" type="main" key="annu_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nūbĭlo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to involve in clouds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overcast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velis adnubilat aura secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:146" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 146</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
annularis: <entryFree id="n2689" type="main" key="annu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annŭlāris, annŭlārius, annŭlā-tus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">annŭlus</orth>, v. anularis, etc. <cb n="ANNU" /></entryFree>
annullo: <entryFree id="n2690" type="main" key="annullo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nullo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ad-nullus</etym>, <sense id="n2690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to annihilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annul</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adnullabunt substantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 21, 5</bibl></cit>: adnullabitur superbia, ib. ib.; v. annihilo.</sense></entryFree>
annumeratio: <entryFree id="n2691" type="main" key="annu^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annŭmĕrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>annumero</etym>, <sense id="n2691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a numbering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
annumero: <entryFree id="n2692" type="main" key="annu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nŭmĕro</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n2692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2692.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to count to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to count out to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put to a person's account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi talentum argenti adnumerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 88</bibl></cit>: argentum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et reddere pecuniam mulieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus singulos denarios alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adnumerare verba sed appendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuique sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2692.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To add to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to include with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon with.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2692.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his libris adnumerandi sunt sex de re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his duobus adnumerabatur nemo tertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:18:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 18, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2692.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in grege adnumeror,</quote> <trans><tr>I am counted with</tr>, <tr>numbered with</tr>, <tr>the multitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 7, 6</bibl>.—Also </sense><sense id="n2692.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos inter urbanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:97" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 97</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n2692.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adnumeratus est cum undecim apostolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 1, 26</bibl></cit>. —In Plin. also, <hi rend="ital">to give the number of something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mandorum nomen iis dedit trecentosque eorum vicos adnumerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2692.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2692.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To attribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impute to</hi> (only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperitia culpae est adnumeranda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n2692.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reckon for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider equal to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni chordi duo pro uno ove adnumerantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
annuntiatio: <entryFree id="n2693" type="main" key="annunti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annuntĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), not <orth extent="full" lang="la">annun-cĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>annuntio</etym>, <sense id="n2693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an announcing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announcement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annunciation</hi> (eccl. and late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,023:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Joan. 1, 5</bibl>; 3, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Sanct. 18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Sanct. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 248</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
annuntiator: <entryFree id="n2694" type="main" key="annunti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annuntĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), not <orth extent="full" lang="la">annuncĭ-ātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an announcer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Sanct. 14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Sanct. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
annuntio: <entryFree id="n2695" type="main" key="annunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nuntĭo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), not <orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nuncĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi> (post-Aug. and mostly eccl.; very freq. in Vulg.). </sense><sense id="n2695.1" n="a" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuntiavere exanimatum illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2695.2" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuntiavit ei, quod occidisset Saül sacerdotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 22, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2695.3" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentibus adnuntiabam, ut paenitentiam agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 26, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2695.4" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuntiabo veritatem tuam,</quote> <trans><tr>I will declare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:88:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 88, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuntia regnum Dei,</quote> <trans><tr>preach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 9, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Evangelium adnuntiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuntiantes Dominum Jesum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 11, 21</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sic adnuntiabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2695.5" n="e" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona regi adnuntiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 18, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:42:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 42, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 4, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2695.6" n="f" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuntiantes ei de puteo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:26:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 26, 32</bibl></cit>; ib. Job, 36, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 16, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 15, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
annuntius: <entryFree id="n2696" type="main" key="annunti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annuntĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), not <orth extent="full" lang="la">annuncĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>annuntio</etym>, <sense id="n2696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that announces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">makes known</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 52, 28</bibl></cit>; Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 9.</sense></entryFree>
annuo: <entryFree id="n2697" type="main" key="annu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nŭo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>ŭi</itype> (ūvi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 882</bibl> P.), <itype>ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>-nuo, whence nutum; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">neu/w</foreign>; cf. abnuo</etym>, <sense id="n2697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to nod to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nod.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2697.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illa ulli homini nutet, nictet, adnuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuerunt sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac adnuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>at the first nod</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuentibus ac vocantibus suis evadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuit, et totum nutu tremefecit Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 106</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to ask by a wink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nod</hi> (opp. renuo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2697.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n2697.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To give assent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">approval by nodding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nod assent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant. promise to do</hi> (constr. with <hi rend="ital">dat. of person</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">acc. of thing</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. of person;</hi> opp. abnuo, to dissent, refuse): <cit><quote lang="la">daturine estis an non? adnuunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: adnuo Terram intuens modeste, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quoque toto capite adnuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adversata petenti Adnuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacibus adnue coeptis,</quote> <trans><tr>be favorable to</tr>, <tr>smile on our undertakings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 625</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiis adnuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adnuit precibus Lysiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Omnia omnibus adnuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 159</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum rex adnuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc.</bibl></cit> <cb n="ANNU" /> 4, 10.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: adnuvit sese mecum decernere ferro, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 882</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego autem venturum adnuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2697.4" n="B" level="2"> Adnuere alicui aliquid; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grant something to one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli quibus adnuis arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin nostrum adnuerit nobis Victoria Martem,</quote> <trans><tr>shall grant us a successful engagement</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni divūm pater adnuisset rebus Aeneae potiore ductos alite muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: adnuite nutum numenque vestrum invictum Campanis, <hi rend="ital">give your assent</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2697.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To designate a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, </sense><sense id="n2697.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">By a nod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos iste adnuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2697.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">By a wink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae adnuit oculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 10, 10</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuunt oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>they make signs with their eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 34, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Prov. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:27:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 27, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2697.8" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">By the hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuens eis manu, ut tacerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnuit manu ad plebem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 21, 40</bibl></cit>. —Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to indicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa adnuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
annus: <entryFree id="n2698" type="main" key="annus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>acc. to some, as Corssen, Beitr. 16, for am-nus, from 2. an- am-; or acc. to others, directly from 2. anus, a ring, and kindred to the form appearing, in <foreign lang="greek">e)noauto/s, di/-enos, tri/-enos</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n2698.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a circuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circular course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periodical return</hi>: tempus a brumā ad brumam, dum sol redit, vocatur annus; <cit><quote lang="la">quod, ut parvi circuli anuli, sic magni dicebantur circites ani, unde annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 8</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">for the same idea: circum tribus actis annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:883" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 883</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno, qui solstitiali circumagitur orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (stellae) volvunt magnos in magnis orbibus annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 644</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 234</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis solis redeuntibus annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 311</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 47</bibl>; cf. also Voss ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 402</bibl>; and the Heb. <foreign /> = month, from <foreign /> = to renew; hence, <hi rend="ital">a year</hi> (consisting among the Rom. orig. of ten months, ending with Dec. and beginning with Mart., but from the time of Numa of twelve): <cit><quote lang="la">annos sexaginta natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio circum tribus actis impiger annis Floret equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 881</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora mutare annorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the seasons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni tempus, Varr, R. R. 1, 46: nemo est tam senex, qui se annum non putet posse vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum et septem complevit annos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">anni fugaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni mobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus piger,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni breves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per exactos annos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initio anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno ineunte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno exeunte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno circumacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertente anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus totus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus solidus,</quote> <trans><tr>a full year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleno anno,</quote> <trans><tr>at the close of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum centum et decem anni sunt, cum lata est lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl></cit>: lex anno post quam lata sit abrogata, id. Cornel. Fragm. ap. Orell. IV. 2, p. 448.—</sense><sense id="n2698.1" n="B" level="2"> Adverb. phrases. </sense><sense id="n2698.2" n="1" level="3"> Anno. </sense><sense id="n2698.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A year ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last year</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">pe/rusi</foreign> (for the most part anteclass.; <cit><quote lang="la">not used by Cic.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor minis ego emi istanc anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 39</bibl>: utrum anno an horno te abstuleris a viro, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 121, 8</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab anno priore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 8, 10</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ab anno praeterito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whole year</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ejus matronae anno luxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 10" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (in Livy, instead of it, annum; v. 2. infra).—</sense><sense id="n2698.5" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In each year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno boum jugo conseri anno quadragena jugera, difficilis tricena justum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 173</bibl></cit>.—But <hi rend="ital">in</hi> is freq. added when it is related how often a thing happened during the year, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter in anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel in anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 9, 7</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">semel per annum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Ex. 30, 10</bibl></cit>) al. (but without <hi rend="ital">in'</hi> ter et quater anno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 184</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n2698.6" n="2" level="3"> Annum, <hi rend="ital">a year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during a whole year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae annum eum luxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n2698.7" n="3" level="3"> Ad annum, <hi rend="ital">for the coming year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a year hence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciendum est ad annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad annum tribunum plebis videbam fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.8" n="4" level="3"> In annum. </sense><sense id="n2698.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">For a year</hi>: prorogatum in annum im <pb n="127" /> <cb n="ANON" /> perium est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 2, 11</bibl>: si quid Est (<hi rend="ital">gnaws</hi>) animum, differs curandi tempus in annum? <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisae frugis in annum Copia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In the next year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the next year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod stercoratione faciunt in annum segetes meliores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.11" n="5" level="3"> Per annos, <hi rend="ital">year by year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva per annos mutant, et superest ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 16, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 2, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.12" n="6" level="3"> Omnibus annis, <hi rend="ital">all the years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">always</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2698.14" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a part of a year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a season of the year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc frondent silvae, nunc formosissimus an-nus,</quote> <trans><tr>now the forest is clothed with verdure</tr>, <tr>now the year is most beautiful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 57</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pomifer annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernus annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: Pisaeumque domus non aestuat annum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the summer</hi> (in which season of the year the Olympic games were celebrated at Pisa), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The produce of the year</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">annona, I.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricolae annum flevere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 452</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:710" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 710</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:424" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 424</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec arare terram aut exspectare annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Rup.; cf. Schwarz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:29" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.16" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Time of life</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Dum vernat sanguis, dum rugis integer annus,</quote> <trans><tr>while your years are free from wrinkles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:59" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae longus et annus erit,</quote> <trans><tr>the years of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.17" n="D" level="2"> In polit. life, <hi rend="ital">the age to which one must attain in order to be appointed to an office</hi> (cf. annalis, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod hoc honore me adfecistis primā petitione, quod anno meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito reliquit annum suum seseque in annum proximum transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui anno suo petierint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2698.18" n="E" level="2"> In astronomy: annus magnus or mundanus, <hi rend="ital">the period of time in which the constellations return to the same place;</hi> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 11, 15,000</bibl> years; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 16</bibl>; and Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
annuto: <entryFree id="n2699" type="main" key="annu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nūto</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n2699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nod often to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nod to</hi> (ante- and postclass.): alii adnutat, alii adnictat, Naev. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 29</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 19 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
annutrio: <entryFree id="n2700" type="hapax" key="annu_tri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-nūtrĭo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adn-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">train up at or near to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboribus vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
annuus: <entryFree id="n2701" type="main" key="annu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">annŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>annus</etym>. <sense id="n2701.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That lasts a year or continues through a year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a year's duration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:46 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 46 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annui victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 46, 47, § 151</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n2701.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That returns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recurs</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">happens every year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annual.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2701.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: annuo in cursu, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 20, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commutationes,</quote> <trans><tr>changes of the seasons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor (agricolarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenitudo annuae messis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponit flavas annua terra comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:48" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua magnae Sacra refer Cereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuos reditus non dabunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Esdr. 4, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">annuā vice,</quote> <trans><tr>annually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuis vicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:44 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 20, 22, § 44 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n2701.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">annŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and more freq. in the <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">annŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an annuity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annual stipend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pension</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publici servi annua accipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui annuum relictum fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:10" default="NO">33, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anodynos: <entryFree id="n2702" type="greek" key="a^no_dy^no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ănōdynŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>a, on</itype> (um), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nw/dunos</foreign>, <sense id="n2702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stilling pain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>an anodyne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ănōdynon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anomalia: <entryFree id="n2703" type="greek" key="a^no_ma^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ănōmălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nwmali/a</foreign>, in gram., <sense id="n2703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irregularity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anomaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=3 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 3 sq.</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
anomalos: <entryFree id="n2704" type="greek" key="a^no_ma^lo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ănōmălŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>a, on</itype> (um), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nw/malos</foreign>, in gram., <sense id="n2704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deviating from the general rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anomalous</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 314</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 833</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, p. 71 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
anonis: <entryFree id="n2705" type="main" key="a^no_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ănōnis</orth>, v. ononis.</entryFree>
anonomastos: <entryFree id="n2706" type="main" key="a^no^no^mastos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ănŏnŏmastos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)nono/mastos</foreign>, unnamed</etym>, designation of one of the æons: aeon. Valent. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 35</bibl>.</entryFree>
anonymos: <entryFree id="n2707" type="greek" key="a^no_ny^mo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ănōnymŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)nw/numos</foreign> (without<cb n="ANSE" />  name), <sense id="n2707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the designation of a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 14, § 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anquina: <entryFree id="n2708" type="main" key="anqui_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anquīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rope by which the sail-yard is bound to the mast</hi>, Cinna ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 4, 7</bibl>; so also Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 536, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anquiro: <entryFree id="n2709" type="main" key="anqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">an-quīro</orth>, <itype>quīsīvi, sītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. anand quaero</etym>, <sense id="n2709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seek on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look about for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to search after.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2709.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> and in gen.: anquirere est circum quaerere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 22</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">anquirere aliquem, apud quem evomet virus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2709.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to inquire about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut anquirunt aut consultant, conducat id necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anquirentibus nobis omnique acie ingenii contemplantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n2709.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. in judic. lang. t. t. </sense><sense id="n2709.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To institute a careful inquiry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">examination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de perduellione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de morte alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2709.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enter a complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accuse one</hi>, with the word designating the punishment in the <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite anquisitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniā anquirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum capitis anquisissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">anquīsītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi> (only in Gell.): <cit><quote lang="la">satis anquisite satisque sollicite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>, where Hertz now reads <hi rend="ital">inquisite.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophrastus anquisitius super hac ipsā re et exactius pressiusque quam Cicero disserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>, where Hertz now reads <hi rend="ital">inquisitius.</hi></sense></entryFree>
anquisitio: <entryFree id="n2710" type="main" key="anqui_si_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anquīsītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>anquiro, II.</etym>, <sense id="n2710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judicial indictment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anquisitionis M. Sergii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6</bibl></cit>, §§ 90 and 92 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ansa: <entryFree id="n2711" type="main" key="ansa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ansa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">xanda/nw</foreign>, and pre-hendo, pre-hensum, and <foreign lang="greek">labh/</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">labei=n</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n2711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that by which something is taken hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haft;</hi> of a vessel, pitcher, vase, and the like. </sense><sense id="n2711.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 653</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:106 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 106 al.</bibl>—Of other things, e. g. of <hi rend="ital">an iron handle of a door</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ansa ostii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 96</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the loop on the edge of a sandal</hi>, through which the shoetie was drawn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 12</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 14</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the handle of the rudder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the tiller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the cheeks of a balance in which the lever moves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>.— In architecture, <hi rend="ital">the cramp-iron</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brace which holds several stones together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:142" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2711.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as also the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">labh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi> (rare, and in the class. per. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">illum quaerere ansam, infectum ut faciat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensionis ansa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ansas sermonis dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi tamquam ansas ad reprehendendum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui lucrandi ansam offerre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ansanctus: <entryFree id="n2712" type="main" key="Ansanctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ansanctus</orth>, v. Amsanctus.</entryFree>
ansatus: <entryFree id="n2713" type="main" key="ansa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ansātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ansa</etym>, <sense id="n2713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">having a handle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capulae a capiendo, quod ansatae, ut prehendi possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:26:35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 26, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>: tela, <hi rend="ital">darts having a thong</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 155 Vahl.).—Also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: ansatae (sc. hastae), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 556, 25</bibl> (Ann. v. 176 Vahl.): homo ansatus, <hi rend="ital">a man with handles</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with his arms a-kimbo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anser: <entryFree id="n2714" type="main" key="anser1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anser</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, usu. <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. hasas; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xh/n</foreign>; Germ. Gans; Engl. Gander; Erse, goss = goose</etym> (<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 4</bibl>; cf. Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Gram. II. p. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. II. p. 7</bibl>; Bentl. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 88</bibl>; Neue, Formenl. I. p. 612 sq.), <sense id="n2714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goose;</hi> sacred to Juno, and which preserved the Capitol in the Gallic war. Hence held in high honor by the Romans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:81 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 26, § 81 al.</bibl>—Anser Amyclaeus, <hi rend="ital">the swan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into which Jupiter changed himself at Amyclœ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 488</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2715" type="main" key="Anser2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Anser</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a petulant and obscene poet</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:435" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 435</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a friend of the triumvir Antonius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who presented him with an estate at Falernum</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5</bibl>). Acc. to Servius, Virgil makes a sportive allusion to him in Ecl. 9, 36: argutos inter strepere anser olores; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ore canorus Anseris indocto carmine cessit olor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:32:84" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 32, 84</bibl></cit>, and Weich. <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> Lat. pp. 159-167.</sense></entryFree>
anserculus: <entryFree id="n2716" type="hapax" key="ansercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ansercŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>anser</etym>, <sense id="n2716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little goose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gosling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anserinus: <entryFree id="n2717" type="main" key="anse^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ansĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to geese</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; Plin. <cb n="ANTE" /> 10, 22, 29, § <cit><quote lang="la">56: pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:47:107:section=257" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 47, 107, § 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeps,</quote> <trans><tr>goose-grease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:30:8:22:section=133 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 30, 8, 22, § 133 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <trans><tr>down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:68" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ansibarii: <entryFree id="n2718" type="main" key="Ansibari^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ansibarĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Cheruscan tribe on the western shore of the Weser</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 56</bibl>; cf. Mann. Germ. 156 sq.</sense></entryFree>
ansula: <entryFree id="n2719" type="main" key="ansu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ansŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ansa</etym>, <sense id="n2719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little handle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">A small ring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hook</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 41</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">A small loop at the edge of sandals for the ties</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
antachates: <entryFree id="n2720" type="greek" key="anta^cha_te_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antăchātēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntaxa/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n2720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 139</bibl>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">aethachates;</hi> others still, <hi rend="ital">autachates.</hi></sense></entryFree>
antae: <entryFree id="n2721" type="main" key="antae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. ante, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n2721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pillars</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pilasters on each side of</hi> (i.e. opposite sides of) <hi rend="ital">doors</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the corners of buildings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4</bibl>.—Hence, aedes in antis, <hi rend="ital">a temple with pilasters on the corners</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antaeopolites: <entryFree id="n2722" type="main" key="Antaeo^po^li_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antaeŏpŏlītes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nomus</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Upper Ægypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antaeus: <entryFree id="n2723" type="main" key="Antaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)antai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n2723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a huge giant in Libya</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:590 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 590 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
antagonista: <entryFree id="n2724" type="greek" key="anta^go_nista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antăgōnista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntagwnisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adversary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opponent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antagonist</hi>, Hier. Vit. Hil. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
antamoebaeus: <entryFree id="n2725" type="main" key="anta^moebaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antămoebaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, pes, in verse (opp. amoebaeus, q. v.), <sense id="n2725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">composed of two short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a short syllable</hi>, as, e. g. mănĭfēstārĕt; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 3, p. 478</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
antandros: <entryFree id="n2726" type="main" key="Antandro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antandrŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/antandros</foreign>, <sense id="n2726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town in Mysia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Antandro</hi> (acc. to Thuc. 8, 108, an Æolic colony), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 123</bibl>; cf. Mann. Asia Min. 3, 418.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Antandrius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Antandros</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antapocha: <entryFree id="n2727" type="greek" key="anta^po^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antăpŏcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntapoxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n2727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the writing by which a debtor showed that he had paid a debt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Cod. 4:21:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Cod. 4, 21, 18</bibl> (opp. apocha).</sense></entryFree>
antapodosis: <entryFree id="n2728" type="greek" key="anta^po^do^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antăpŏdŏsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntapo/dosis</foreign>; <sense id="n2728.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in rhet.,</quote> <trans><tr>the application of a similitude to the object compared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 77</bibl></cit>; v. apodosis.</sense></entryFree>
antarados: <entryFree id="n2729" type="main" key="Anta^ra^dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antărădos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harbor and town in the northern part of Phœnicia and over against the island of Aradus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence its name</hi>, Tab. Peuting. Itin. Ant.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antarcticus: <entryFree id="n2730" type="greek" key="antarcti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antarctĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ntarktiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">southern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 1, 6</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 57 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 24</bibl> Müll., written as a Greek word).</sense></entryFree>
antariumbellum: <entryFree id="n2731" type="gloss" key="anta_rium bellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antārium bellum</orth>: quod ante urbem geritur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 8</bibl> Müll. [ante].</entryFree>
antarius: <entryFree id="n2732" type="main" key="anta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)ntai/rw</foreign>, to raise against</etym>, <sense id="n2732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for raising up</hi>: funes, <hi rend="ital">the cables for raising a scaffold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mast</hi>, and the like, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ante: <entryFree id="n2733" type="main" key="ante^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">anti</orth>, <itype>whence antidea, antideo</itype>, antidhac; v. antea, anteeo, and antehac) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/</foreign>, over against, facing, <foreign lang="greek">a)/nta, a)/nthn</foreign>; Sanscr. anti = over against; Germ. ant- in Ant-wort = Goth. anda-vaurdi, an answer, anda-nahti, the night before], <pos>prep.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to Max. Victor. p. 1953, as <pos>prep.</pos> with the grave accent; as <pos>adv.</pos> with the acute on the last syl.). <sense id="n2733.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">before</hi> (syn.: prae, pro). </sense><sense id="n2733.1" n="A" level="2"> In space, or trop. in regard to estimation, judgment, or rank (usu. only of objects at rest. while <hi rend="ital">prae</hi> is used of those in motion; cf. Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl>; v. exceptions infra). </sense><sense id="n2733.2" n="1" level="3"> In space: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ante aedīs video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ostium Me audivit stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ornatas paulo ante fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 227</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante meum limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:190" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante suum fundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante suos hortulos postridie piscarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante sepulcrales infelix adstitit aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 480</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 344</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 545</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:268" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 268</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante altaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 155</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 5, 24</bibl>. —Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hosce deos erant arulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quīs ante ora patrum contigit oppetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 477</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius unam (navem) ante oculos pontus in puppim ferit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 531</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 773</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante se statuit funditores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Flos Asiae ante ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si luditur alea pernox Ante Numantinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos collocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos errat domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <pb n="128" /> <cb n="ANTE" /> causam ante eum diceret, <hi rend="ital">before him as judge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec stet ante judicium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Josh. 20, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 13, 9</bibl>.—And in eccl. Lat., after the Heb. and Hel. Gr., <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the sight of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the judgment of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante Dominum vilior fiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 6, 21</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">non te justifices ante Deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justi ambo ante Deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and fully: fecit Asa rectum ante conspectum Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 3 Reg. 15, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 12, 10</bibl>.—Hence, homines ante pedes (in later Lat.), <hi rend="ital">servants;</hi> cf. the annotators upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 143</bibl>.—With verbs of motion: <cit><quote lang="la">ante me ito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatum omnem ante se mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ceteras cohortes extra aciem procurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecurrit ante omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 40 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 27, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Reg. 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of preference in judgment, or regulations in respect to rank, <hi rend="ital">before</hi> (this is properly the signification of <hi rend="ital">prae</hi>, q. v.; hence more rare than that, and never used by Cic.): quem ante me diligo, <hi rend="ital">before myself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more than myself</hi>, Balbus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl>.—So ante aliquem esse, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel any one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundiā Graecos, gloriā belli Gallos ante Romanos fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 3</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Corte and Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">tum me vero et ante Alexandrum et ante Pyrrhum et ante omnes alios imperatores esse,</quote> <trans><tr>superior to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitas ante rationem est,</quote> <trans><tr>necessity knows no law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence very freq. (but mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.), </sense><sense id="n2733.4" n="a" level="4"> Ante alios, ante omnes, ante ceteros, etc., <hi rend="ital">before others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before all</hi>, etc., to designate a comparative relation; <cit><quote lang="la">also sometimes, for the sake of emphasis, with comparatives and superlatives: tibi, Neptune, ante alios deos gratias ago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scito illum ante omnīs minumi mortalem preti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua ante omnes experientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 76</bibl></cit>;
