<bibl default="NO">1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junoni ante omnīs candentis vaccae media inter cornua (pateram) fundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ipse est ante omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O felix una ante alias Priameïa virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante omnes furor est insignis equarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere ante alios immanior omnīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 347</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante alios pulcherrimus omnīs Turnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; cf. Rudd. II. p. 82; II. p. 101; II. p. 305.—</sense><sense id="n2733.5" n="b" level="4"> Ante omnia. </sense><sense id="n2733.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Before all things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first of all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus ante omnia ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oportet autem ante omnia os nudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ante omnia instituit, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ante omnia autem, fratres, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1</bibl> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 4, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Comparatively, <hi rend="ital">above all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chiefty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica maestitia eo ante omnia insignis, quia matronae annum, ut parentem, eum luxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae natura multis et ante omnia ursis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 35, 53, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces ante omnia Musae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Muses pleasing above all things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 475</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformem et taetrum ante omnia vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.8" n="(g)" level="5"> In entering upon the discussion of several particulars, or in adducing arguments, <hi rend="ital">first of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the first place</hi> (similar to ac primum quidem, <foreign lang="greek">kai\ prw=ton me\n ou)=n</foreign>; cf. Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ante omnia quid sit rhetorice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante omnia igitur imitatio per se ipsa non sufficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:40" default="NO">4, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:52" default="NO">4, 2, 52</bibl>; 5, 13, 6; 9, 1, 23.—</sense><sense id="n2733.9" n="B" level="2"> Of time. </sense><sense id="n2733.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Before</hi>: ANTE MERIDIEM CAVSAM CONICITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 13</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Dirks. Transl. 177 sq.: ante lucem a portu me praemisisti domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 259</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 24, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante diem caupo sciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante brumam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pereundum erit ante lucernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:339" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante haec omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 21, 12</bibl></cit>.— The designation of time is often expressed paraphrastically. </sense><sense id="n2733.11" n="a" level="4"> By a person who lived at the time: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ante Socratem,</quote> <trans><tr>before the time of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui honos togato habitus ante me est nemini,</quote> <trans><tr>before me</tr>, <tr>before my time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante Jovem nulli subigebant arva coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixere fortes ante Agamemnona Multi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante Helenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ante eum nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2733.12" n="b" level="4"> By other objects pertaining to a particular time: ante hoc <cb n="ANTE" /> factum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante has meas litteras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>before the receipt of this letter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hunc castissimum ante regiam injuriam sanguinem juro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante mare et terras, et quod tegit omnia, caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante sidus fervidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:27" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 61</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:428" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 428</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hoc discunt omnes ante alpha et beta,</quote> <trans><tr>before their A B C</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ante tubam tremor occupat artus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tecum prius ergo voluta Haec ante tubas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 169</bibl></cit>.—Also by the designation of the office of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aedilitatem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante sceptrum Dictaei regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante imperium ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:66" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relictis multis filiis et in regno et ante regnum susceptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—And by the designation of office in app. to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuus est ante istum praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docuerant fabulas ante hos consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ante illum imperatorem clipeis uterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ante se imperatorem nemo ausus sit aspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—A <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fut. pass.</hi> is freq. added to such substantives for the sake of explanation: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hanc urbem conditam,</quote> <trans><tr>before the founding of this city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit> (opp. post urbem conditam): <cit><quote lang="la">non multo ante urbem captam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante Epaminondam natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante te cognitum multis orantibus opem tuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante decemviros creatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2733.13" n="2" level="3"> Hence particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n2733.14" n="a" level="4"> Ante tempus, </sense><sense id="n2733.15" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Before the right time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante tempus excitatis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.16" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Before the appointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lawful time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factus est consul bis, primum ante tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores et ante tempus et quosdam novi generis cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venisti ante tempus torquere nos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 8, 29</bibl></cit> (cf. annus, II. D.).—</sense><sense id="n2733.17" n="b" level="4"> Ante diem, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, </sense><sense id="n2733.18" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Before the time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaribus virtus contigit ante diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante diem vultu gressuque superbo Vicerat aequales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:108" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.19" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Before the time destined by fate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius ante diem patrios inquirit in annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic dolor ante diem Pandiona misit ad umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:675" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 675</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 739</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed misera ante diem subitoque accensa furore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 697</bibl></cit> (cf. Soph. Antig. 461: <foreign lang="greek">ei) de\ tou= xro/nou pro/sqen qanou=mai</foreign>). —</sense><sense id="n2733.20" n="c" level="4"> Ante hunc diem, with a negative: <cit><quote lang="la">istunc hominem numquam audivi ante hunc diem,</quote> <trans><tr>never before this day</tr>, <tr>never until now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque umquam ante hunc diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Novum crimen et ante hunc diem inauditum ad te Q. Tubero detulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 17</bibl>: neque eum ante usquam conspexi prius). —</sense><sense id="n2733.21" n="3" level="3"> Ante diem (abbrev. a. d.) with an ordinal number gives the date, not of the foregoing, but of the present day; e. g. ante diem quintum (a. d. V.) Kalendas Apriles, <hi rend="ital">the fifth day before the calends of April.</hi> Orig. the ante belonged to Kalendas, and they said either, ante die quinto Kalendas (i. e. die quinto ante Kalendas), or ante diem quintum Kalendas; the latter phraseology became the prevailing one, and ante diem, being considered as one word, the <hi rend="ital">prepp. in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> could be prefixed; cf. Manut. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12</bibl>; Duker ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23</bibl>; Rudd. II. p. 291; Madv. Gr. Suppl. I.; Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 2, 12</bibl>: me ante diem XIII. Kalendas Januarias principem revocandae libertatis fuisse, <hi rend="ital">the thirteenth before the calends of January</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the</hi> 20<hi rend="ital">th of Dec.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 7, 20</bibl>: ante diem XII. Kalendas Novembres, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> 21<hi rend="ital">st of Oct.</hi>: ante diem VI. Kalendas Novembres, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> 27<hi rend="ital">th of Oct.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3</bibl>: ante diem VIII. Kalendas Decembres, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> 24<hi rend="ital">th of Nov.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 8</bibl>: a. d. IV. Id. Mart. (ante diem quartum Idus Martias), i. e. <hi rend="ital">the</hi> 12<hi rend="ital">th of March</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 59</bibl>: ante diem III. Non. Jan. M. Cicero natus est, i. e. <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> 3<hi rend="ital">d of Jan.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:28 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 28 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ante diem quartum Kal. Dec. distulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: caedem te optimatium contulisse in ante diem V. Kal. Nov., <hi rend="ital">to the</hi> 28<hi rend="ital">th of Oct.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ante diem VII. Id. Febr.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: nuntii venerant ex ante diem Non. Jun. usque ad prid. Kal. Sept., <hi rend="ital">from the</hi> 3<hi rend="ital">d of June</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatio indicta est ante diem V. Id. Oct. cum eo die in quinque dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.22" n="4" level="3"> Sometimes to designate the whole <cb n="ANTE" /> time until the passing moment: <cit><quote lang="la">ante id tempus et mari et terrā duces erant Lace daemonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui honos huic uni ante id tempus contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timoth. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictus ante eam diem fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.23" n="5" level="3"> Ante annos, <hi rend="ital">before the destined time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ante suos annos occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ante annos animumque gerens curamque virilem,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond his years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 311</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suos annos praeterire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:428" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 428</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">annos transcendere factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:348" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 348</bibl></cit>). —</sense><sense id="n2733.24" n="6" level="3"> Ante hoc, for antea, antehac, belongs to the later Latin: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hoc incognita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hoc domūs pars videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n2733.25" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, of space and time (the latter most freq.). </sense><sense id="n2733.26" n="A" level="2"> Of space, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forwards</hi>: post me erat Aegina, ante Megara, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius ab tergo, ante circaque velut ripa praeceps oram ejus omnem cingebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronatus stabit et ante calix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:98" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena oculis et ante et retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of motion (cf. supra, I. A. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">si aut manibus ingrediatur quis aut non ante, sed retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallida Tisiphone morbos agit ante metumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 552</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.27" n="B. 1." level="1"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previously</hi> (always in reference to another past time, while ante as <pos>prep.</pos> is used in reference to the present). </sense><sense id="n2733.28" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne oportuit Praescīsse me ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id te oro, ut ante eamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq. in Cic.: quod utinam illi ante accidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ante acta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut ante fecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jud. 16, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus omnis ante actae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 115</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud vos ante feci mentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam hoc non novum, sed ab eis ante factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:243" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:320" default="NO">15, 320</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud de quo ante dixi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sex. Rosc. 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ante dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad modum ante dixi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">additis, quae ante deliquerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium ante sublatum brevi amisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 43</bibl>.—And often accomp. by <hi rend="ital">jam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceperam jam ante Caesaris litteras, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 23</bibl>.—Rarely accomp. by <hi rend="ital">saepe.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut saepe ante fecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.29" n="b" level="4"> Rarely with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non filius ante pudicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos acciverat, incertum, experiens an et ante gnavos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.30" n="c" level="4"> Often with <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> in the <case>abl.</case> or <case>acc.</case> for a more accurate designation of time (cf. also abhinc with the <case>abl.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> in these cases ante was considered by the ancient critics as a <pos>prep.</pos>, which could also govern the <case>abl.</case>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 209</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 1, 30</bibl>. The position of ante is sometimes before and sometimes after the subst., and sometimes between the numeral and the subst.): <cit><quote lang="la">illos septem et multis ante saeculis Lycurgum accepimus fuisse sapientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi perpaucis ante diebus (i. e. before the departure of Theophilus, of whom mention is afterwards made) dederam Q. Mucio litteras ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis diebus ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti annis ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voverat eam annis undecim ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 52, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae bello Ligustico ante annis octo vovisset): optimum erit ante annum scrobes facere,</quote> <trans><tr>a year before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyron urbem ante annum Trojanae cladis condiderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>a year before the fall of Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quadriennium amissus es,</quote> <trans><tr>four years previously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot ante annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 12</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n2733.31" n="d" level="4"> With the <hi rend="ital">advv. multo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paulo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquanto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tanto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quanto</hi>, and rarely <hi rend="ital">permultum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo ante prospexi tempestatem futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud multo ante adventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl></cit>.—And in the order ante multo: <cit><quote lang="la">ante multo a te didicerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venisti paulo ante in senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 30</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 29 et saep.—And in the order ante paulo: quae ante paulo perbreviter attigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profectus est aliquanto ante furorem Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 20, 56</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">bis;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 149</bibl>.—And in the order ante aliquanto: ante aliquanto quam tu natus es, Cic. Fam. <pb n="129" /> <cb n="ANTE" /> 10, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto ante praedixeras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si Cleomenes non tanto ante fugisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 78, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 26</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto ante providerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permultum ante certior factus eram litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1191</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n2733.32" n="2" level="3"> Followed by <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (written also as one word, antequam; the form prius quam was more freq. in archaic Latin), <hi rend="ital">sooner than; before.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2733.33" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ind. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quam doceo id factum non esse, libet mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quam ad sententiam redeo, de me pauca dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.34" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ind. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini Catonem anno ante quam est mortuus mecum disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno ipso ante quam natus est Ennius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aliquanto quam tu natus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ante dimisit eum quam fidem dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quam ille est factus inimicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.35" n="c" level="4"> Rarely with <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante provinciam sibi decretam audiet quam potuerit tempus ei rei datum suspicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque defatigabor ante quam ... percepero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.36" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quam veniat in Pontum, litteras ad Cn. Pompeium mittet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac lege ante omnia veniunt, quam gleba una ematur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 60</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 4 Reg. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 6, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.37" n="e" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae et ad urbem, ante quam proficisceretur, quaerere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (sol) ante quam se abderet, fugientem vidit Antonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 8, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.38" n="f" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante vero quam sit ea res adlata, laetitiā frui satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticum malum opprimit ante quam prospicere potueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ante vincere desierint quam Rubro mari inclusis quod vincerent defuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ante (barbam capillumque) dempserit quam vindicāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.39" n="g" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. pluperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ante quam eam uxorem duxisset domum, sperāsse etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ante quam de meo adventu audire potuissent, in Macedoniam perrexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consul ante fieret, quam ullum alium magistratum capere licuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 171</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.40" n="h" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dici vix potest quam multa sint quae respondeatis ante fieri oportere, quam ad hanc rationem devenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.41" n="i" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armati nullum ante finem pugnae quam morientes fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 15, 4</bibl></cit> (on the use of these different constructions, v. Roby, §§ 1671, 1462, 1672 etc.; Draeger, Hist. Synt. II. pp. 589 sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">and esp. Fischer, Gr. § 621). —In the poets sometimes with quam before ante: Respice item quam nil ad nos anteacta vetustas Temporis aeterni fuerit, quam nascimur ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:972" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 972</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non ego signatis quicquam mandare tabellis, Ne legat id nemo quam meus ante, velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:7:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36, 6</bibl>.—Also in the poets sometimes pleon. ante—prius—quam: <cit><quote lang="la">sed mihi vel tellus optem prius ima dehiscat Ante, pudor, quam te violo aut tua jura resolvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">prius—quam— ante: Aut prius infecto deposcit praemia cursu, Septima quam metam triverit ante rota?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2733.42" n="3" level="3"> For the designation of order, foll. by tum, deinde, etc., <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the first place</hi> (only in later Lat. for the class. primum): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante caput, deinde reliqua pars auferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ante dicam de his, quae, etc.: tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante tonderi ... deinde ... tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 34, § 131</bibl> dub.—</sense><sense id="n2733.43" n="4" level="3"> Very rarely used as <pos>adj.</pos> (in imitation of the Greek): <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim ignari sumus ante malorum,</quote> <trans><tr>earlier</tr>, <tr>previous ills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 198</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">tw=n pa/ros kakw=n</foreign>, Soph. O. T. 1423): <cit><quote lang="la">ille elegit, qui recipit ante meliorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:82:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 82, 5</bibl> (on this use of the <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Kritz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 5</bibl>).</sense><sense id="n2733.44" n="III" level="1"> In composition. </sense><sense id="n2733.45" n="A" level="2"> Of space, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in front of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forwards</hi>: antepono, antefigo, antefero, antemitto.—</sense><sense id="n2733.46" n="B" level="2"> Fig. of preference, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>: antepono.—</sense><sense id="n2733.47" n="C" level="2"> Of degree, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more</hi>: antepotens, antepollens—</sense><sense id="n2733.48" n="D" level="2"> In designations of time <cb n="ANTE" /> only with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: antelucanus, antemeridianus, antehac, antelucio.With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>, ante is more correctly written separately: ante actus, ante factus, ante gestus, ante paro, etc., although editions differ in this respect. V. more upon this word in Hand, Turs. I. pp. 361-390, and pp. 394-402.</sense></entryFree>
antea: <entryFree id="n2734" type="main" key="ante^a_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕā</orth>, <sense id="n2734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">temp. adv.</hi> (old form * <orth extent="full" lang="la">antidĕā</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">anteidĕā</orth>, MS., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 6</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. II. p. 680) [ante-eā like antehāc, posteā, posthāc, proptereā, quāpropter, etc., in which Corssen, Ausspr. I. p. 769, regards the <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> as an old <case>acc.</case> with the <hi rend="ital">a</hi> final long; Key, Gr. § 802, regards these suffixes as corrupted from the <case>acc.</case> of pronouns in -am; cf. quam], of some (past or pres.) time, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earlier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aforetime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in time past</hi>, etc. (relative; while antehac demonstr. is used only in ref. to present time. The use of antea for prius is censured by Atticus in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n2734.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam antea Quī scire posses aut ingenium noscere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antea, cum equester ordo judicaret, improbi et rapaces magistratus in provinciis inserviebant publicanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac fuit antea tempus, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum antea semper factiosus fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et antea laudatus et hoc tempore laudandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 17 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc audiebant antea, nunc praesentem vident, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 41 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si antea fuit ignotum, nuper est cognitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quales antea fuerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ex. 34, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:36:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 36, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 23, 12</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n2734.2" n="II" level="1"> Freq. opp. to postea, post, posthac, tum, tunc, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">et clari fuerunt, et antea fuerant, nec postea defecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc consuetudinem jam antea minuebamus, post Sullae victoriam penitus amisimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non accusabimur posthac: neque antea neglegentes fuimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper ille antea cum uxore, tum sine eā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">antea ... tunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2734.3" n="III" level="1"> Rarely for ante followed by deinde, mox, etc.: clipeis antea Romani usi sunt, deinde scuta pro clipeis fecere, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at an earlier period</hi> ... <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in process of time</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poneropolis antea, mox Philippopolis, nunc Trimontium dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2734.4" n="IV" level="1"> Rarely also for ante, followed by quam: <cit><quote lang="la">te antea, quam tibi successum esset, decessurum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">Achaei non antea ausi capessere bellum, quam ab Romā revertissent legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 25, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb.</sense></entryFree>
anteactus: <entryFree id="n2735" type="main" key="anteactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">anteactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">anteago</orth>; better written separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ante actus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ante ago</orth>; v. ante and ago.</entryFree>
anteambulo: <entryFree id="n2736" type="main" key="ante^ambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-ambŭlo</orth> (in poetry four syll.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ambulo, āre</etym>, <sense id="n2736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forerunner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a servant that went before distinguished personages to clear the way</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">anteambulo regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 74, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
anteaquam: <entryFree id="n2737" type="main" key="ante^a_quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕāquam</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">antea quam</orth>, v. antea, IV.</entryFree>
antebasis: <entryFree id="n2738" type="main" key="ante^ba^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕbăsis</orth>, v. antibasis.</entryFree>
antecanis: <entryFree id="n2739" type="main" key="Ante^ca^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Antĕ-cănis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, transl. of <foreign lang="greek">*proku/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n2739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Lesser Dog-star</hi>, so called as rising <hi rend="ital">before the Dog-star</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antecanis Graio Procyon qui nomine fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 222</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 268</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antecantamentum: <entryFree id="n2740" type="hapax" key="ante^canta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-cantāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cantamen</etym>, <sense id="n2740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prelude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overture</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 24</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
antecantativus: <entryFree id="n2741" type="main" key="ante^canta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-cantātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canto</etym>, <sense id="n2741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a prelude</hi>, Marc. Vict. p. 2500 P.</sense></entryFree>
antecapio: <entryFree id="n2742" type="main" key="ante^ca^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-căpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to obtain before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to receive before.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2742.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: quam appellat <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyin</foreign> Epicurus, anteceptam animo rei quandam informationem, <hi rend="ital">an inborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innate idea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 43</bibl> B. and K. (cf. anticipatio, I.).—</sense><sense id="n2742.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n2742.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take possession of beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preoccupy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa antecapere, quae bello usui forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 32, 3</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem anteceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 66</bibl></cit> Halm.—</sense><sense id="n2742.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To anticipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem antecapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea omnia luxu antecapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antecedo: <entryFree id="n2743" type="main" key="ante^ce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n2743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> <cb n="ANTE" /> <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi> (in space), <hi rend="ital">to take the lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get the start;</hi> with <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2743.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2743.2" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: ubi ambitionem virtuti videas antecedere, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 499, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si huic rei illa antecedit, huic non antecedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2743.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius expeditus antecesserat legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: biduo me Antonius antecessit, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antecedite me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 32, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 2, 9</bibl>, and so Vulg. always.—</sense><sense id="n2743.4" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis itineribus antecessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antecedente famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: antecedens scelestus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2743.5" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n2743.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To precede</hi>, in time: haec (dies) ei antecessit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatio semper antecedere cibum debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2743.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To have the precedence of</hi> any one, <hi rend="ital">to excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> and <case>acc.</case> (cf. Rudd. II. p. 136). </sense><sense id="n2743.8" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute regi antecesseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum natura hominis pecudibus antecedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2743.9" n="b" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> of person or thing and <case>abl.</case> or <case>abl.</case> with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiā atque usu nauticarum rerum ceteros antecedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo eum in amicitiā antecessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maltha duritiam lapidis antecedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 58, § 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2743.10" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become eminent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque honore et aetate antecedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 22</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n2743.11" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕcēdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n2743.12" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Octav. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 8, 16, § 59</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2743.13" n="b" level="4"> T. t. of philosophy, <hi rend="ital">the antecedent</hi> (opp. consequens): <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 11, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 34</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">an-tĕcēdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ex antecedentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:66" default="NO">6, 3, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2743.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕces-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that goes before;</hi> only in the connection, in antecessum dare, solvere, accipere, etc.; t. t., <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in advance</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in antecessum dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:24 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 24 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
antecello: <entryFree id="n2744" type="main" key="ante^cello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-cello</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n2744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> not used), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>-cello</etym>; lit., <hi rend="ital">to project;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to be prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish one's self;</hi> and with <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish one's self above</hi> any one, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superior to;</hi> and with <hi rend="ital">abl. of respect</hi> (a favorite word with Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): qui, quā re homines bestiis praestent, eā in re hominibus ipsis antecellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile omnibus terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3</bibl>; Corn. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 897</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 3, 5, 10 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinam stirpem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8</bibl>, n. 1.—Without the oblique case of the person: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitate antecellens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitione astrorum sollertiāque ingeniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41</bibl></cit>. —* <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: qui omnibus his rebus antecelluntur, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 30, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antecenium: <entryFree id="n2745" type="main" key="ante^ce_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-cēnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cena</etym>, <sense id="n2745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meal taken before the principal meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lunch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luncheon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, trop.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121, 29</bibl></cit> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
anteceptus: <entryFree id="n2746" type="main" key="ante^ceptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕceptus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> of antecapio.</entryFree>
antecessio: <entryFree id="n2747" type="main" key="ante^cessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕcessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>antecedo</etym>. <sense id="n2747.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preceding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in orbibus conversiones antecessionesque eveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2747.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which goes before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the antecedent cause</hi>, as opp. to the final cause (perh. only in Cic.): homo causas rerum videt earumque progressus et quasi antecessiones non ignorat, <hi rend="ital">and understands their course forwards and backwards</hi>, i. e. can reason from cause to effect and from effect to cause, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consecutio, antecessio, repugnantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antecessor: <entryFree id="n2748" type="main" key="ante^cessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕcessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that goes before;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n2748.1" n="I" level="1"> In milit. lang., antecessores, <hi rend="ital">the forerunners of the army</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the advanced guard</hi> (cf. antecursor): speculatores et antecessores, Auct. B. Afr. 12: agminis antecessores, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2748.2" n="II" level="1"> In the jurists, </sense><sense id="n2748.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Teachers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">professors of law</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2748.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A predecessor in office</hi> (opp. successor): <cit><quote lang="la">ad antecessores meos Apostolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:55" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:9:9" default="NO">27, 9, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2748.5" n="III" level="1"> Tert. thus designates the Holy <pb n="130" /> <cb n="ANTE" /> Ghost, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and also the Apostles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antecessus: <entryFree id="n2749" type="main" key="ante^cessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕcessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from antecedo.</entryFree>
antecurro: <entryFree id="n2750" type="main" key="ante^curro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-curro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n2750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella solem antecurrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antecursor: <entryFree id="n2751" type="main" key="ante^cursor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕcursor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>antecurro</etym>, <sense id="n2751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that runs before;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n2751.1" n="I" level="1"> In milit. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">antecursores,</quote> <trans><tr>the forerunners of the army</tr>, <tr>the advanced guard</tr>, <tr>precursors</tr>, <tr>pioneers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 36</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 12, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2751.2" n="II" level="1"> In Tert. John the Baptist is so named, as <hi rend="ital">the forerunner</hi> of Christ, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
antedico: <entryFree id="n2752" type="main" key="ante^di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕdīco</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕdictus</orth>, <itype>better written separately</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ante dīco</orth>, etc., v. ante and dico.</entryFree>
anteeo: <entryFree id="n2753" type="main" key="ante^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕ-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">antĭdeo</orth> = anteeo, like antidea for antea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <sense id="n2753.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">antidit = anteit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 145</bibl></cit> Ritschl. In verse the <hi rend="ital">e</hi> in ante blends with the foll. <hi rend="ital">e</hi> or <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, per synaloephen, into one syll.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, anteire trisyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4</bibl></cit> [141]; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 70 al.</bibl>; later we find the sync. forms: <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> antēat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 726</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> antībo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi> antīssent, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 69</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> antīsse, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 40</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n2753.1" n="I" level="1"> In space, <hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take the lead;</hi> with <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2753.2" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum montes Montibus anteire (videntur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4</bibl></cit> [141]: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoribus anteeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2753.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te anteit necessitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2753.4" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarum jubebat anteire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n2753.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2753.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go before</hi>: anteibit faciem tuam justitia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 58, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n2753.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus omnibus rebus anteit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui omnīs homines supero atque antideo cruciabilitatibus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sapientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem meam honoribus vestris anteistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candore nives, cursibus auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:84 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 84 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se aequales tui, abs te anteiri putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a deterioribus honore anteiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 101</bibl>.—More rare, </sense><sense id="n2753.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To anticipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent any thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnationem anteiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2753.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritati parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n2753.10" n="E" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to know beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foreknow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vellet crastinus Auster, Anteibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:455" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 455</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
antefactus: <entryFree id="n2754" type="main" key="ante^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">antĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; better written separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ante factus</orth>, v. ante and factus.</entryFree>
